column4: i just want to play mp3's, is it really this hard just to get xmms to work?
yes, i will get the internet. in time.
it does not recognise my wireless, so i figured i'd play a few tunes as this computer doesn't haqve a soundcard...
if i take the wireless otu of this computer, i lose my ability to use the internet, and ubuntu doesn't recognise my device
alright. i'll just give up and play audio cd's.
incidently, is it easy to get ubuntu to recognise a usb wireless device?
yes, steve. but i don't have internet available.
i have xmms downloaded as a tar and sitting on the ubuntu desktop.
apparently it's too hard to install without the internet.
the bottom line is the codecs needed are online only
ok, so get the correct packages online and install them from a cd
that libary is part oa package though
of a package that should read
there is no need for that language
